phrase_cn: 他诚然**担当**了我们的忧患
nuance_note: Borne (Nasa) 暗示背负重担或刑罚，Took 只是拿走。
sentence_context: Surely he has borne our griefs and carried our sorrows; yet we esteemed him stricken, smitten by God, and afflicted.

phrase_en: Shall **mount up** with wings like eagles
nuance_note: Mount up 描绘借助气流强力攀升的宏大画面，Fly 太普通。
sentence_context: but they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.
Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth; for the LORD has spoken: 'Children have I reared and brought up, but they have rebelled against me.'
nuance_note: Highlights the profound ingratitude and disobedience (פָּשַׁע) against God's fatherly care, a primary cause of judgment.

sentence_context: A remnant will return, the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.
nuance_note: The theological concept of a 'remnant' (שְׁאָר) refers to a preserved, faithful core chosen for salvation, not merely discarded remains.

sentence_context: You keep him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on you, because he trusts in you.
nuance_note: Emphasizes the active and steadfast reliance (בָּטַח) on God as the sole source of perfect peace and stability.

sentence_context: Therefore the LORD waits to be gracious to you, and therefore he exalts himself to show you mercy. For the LORD is a God of justice; blessed are all those who wait for him.
nuance_note: Waiting (חָכָה) implies patient expectation and hope, not passive idleness, anticipating God's deliverance and mercy.

sentence_context: even to your old age I am he, and to gray hairs I will carry you. I have made, and I will bear; I will carry and will save.
nuance_note: God's promise to 'bear' (סָבַל) His people signifies His continuous, sustaining care and responsibility throughout their lives, not just simple transportation.

sentence_context: For the LORD comforts Zion; he comforts all her waste places and will make her wilderness like Eden, her desert like the garden of the LORD; joy and gladness will be found in her, thanksgiving and the voice of song.
nuance_note: Divine 'comfort' (נָחַם) involves active restoration and transformation from desolation to joy, far beyond mere passive relaxation.

sentence_context: The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me, because the LORD has anointed me to bring good news to the poor; he has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to those who are bound;
nuance_note: To 'proclaim' (קָרָא) here is to authoritatively declare and initiate a new reality of freedom and salvation, not just announce.

phrase_en: Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son
sentence_context: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
nuance_note: The term 'virgin' (עַלְמָה) in this context specifically denotes a young woman of marriageable age who is a virgin, emphasizing the miraculous nature of the sign of Immanuel.

phrase_en: rely on horses, who trust in chariots
sentence_context: Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help and rely on horses, who trust in chariots because they are many and in horsemen because they are very strong, but do not look to the Holy One of Israel or consult the LORD!
nuance_note: Highlights the misplaced 'trust' (בָּטַח) in human military might (Egypt) instead of in God, leading to divine judgment.

phrase_en: and he shall bear their iniquities
sentence_context: Out of the anguish of his soul he shall see and be satisfied; by his knowledge shall the righteous one, my servant, make many to be accounted righteous, and he shall bear their iniquities.
nuance_note: The Servant's 'bearing' (סָבַל) of iniquities signifies taking on the guilt and punishment of others, a profound act of vicarious atonement.

phrase_cn: 看哪！神是我的拯救，我要倚靠他，并不惧怕；因为耶和华是我的力量，是我的诗歌，他也成了我的拯救。”
phrase_en: Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and will not be afraid; for the LORD God is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation.”
sentence_context: “Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and will not be afraid; for the LORD God is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation.”
nuance_note: 倚靠 (trust) signifies complete reliance and dependence on God for salvation and strength, a core aspect of new covenant faith.

phrase_cn: 所以，我要使他与众多的得份，与强盛的均分掳物；因为他倾倒自己的生命，以致于死，他也被列在罪犯之中。他却担当了多人的罪，又为罪犯代求。
phrase_en: Therefore I will divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong, because he poured out his soul to death and was numbered with the transgressors; yet he bore the sin of many, and makes intercession for the transgressors.
sentence_context: Therefore I will divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong, because he poured out his soul to death and was numbered with the transgressors; yet he bore the sin of many, and makes intercession for the transgressors.
nuance_note: 担当 (bear) here means to take on the guilt, punishment, and consequences of others' sin, a theological burden, not merely to physically carry an object.

phrase_cn: 看哪，先前的事已经成就，现在我将新事宣告；它们还未发生，我就先告诉你们了。”
phrase_en: Behold, the former things have come to pass, and new things I now declare; before they spring forth I proclaim them to you.”
sentence_context: Behold, the former things have come to pass, and new things I now declare; before they spring forth I proclaim them to you.”
nuance_note: 宣告 (proclaim/declare) here refers to God's authoritative and certain declaration of future events, emphasizing His sovereign control over history and salvation.

phrase_cn: “你们要安慰，安慰我的百姓！” 你们的神说。
phrase_en: Comfort, comfort my people, says your God.
sentence_context: “Comfort, comfort my people, says your God.
nuance_note: 安慰 (comfort) implies deep spiritual consolation, restoration, and reassurance from God, addressing the suffering and guilt of His people, not just superficial relaxation.

phrase_cn: 到那日，主必二次伸手，救回自己百姓中所余剩的，就是从亚述、埃及、巴特罗、古实、以拦、示拿、哈马，并众海岛所剩下的。
phrase_en: In that day the Lord will extend his hand yet a second time to recover the remnant that remains of his people, from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, from Elam, from Shinar, from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.
sentence_context: In that day the Lord will extend his hand yet a second time to recover the remnant that remains of his people, from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, from Elam, from Shinar, from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.
nuance_note: 余民 (remnant) refers to a small, divinely preserved and chosen group of people who survive judgment and are destined for future salvation and restoration, not just 'leftovers'.

phrase_cn: 从古以来，人未曾听见，未曾耳闻，也未曾眼见在你以外有神为等候他的人行事。
phrase_en: From of old no one has heard or perceived by the ear, no eye has seen a God besides you, who acts for those who wait for him.
sentence_context: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard nor perceived by the ear, nor has the eye seen any God besides You, who acts for the one who waits for Him.
nuance_note: 等候 (wait for) implies an active, hopeful, and patient expectation of God's intervention and fulfillment of His promises, rooted in trust, not passive idleness.

phrase_cn: 主耶和华—以色列的圣者曾如此说：“你们得救在于悔改和安息；你们得力在于平静和倚靠。” 你们却不肯。
phrase_en: For thus said the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel, “In returning and rest you shall be saved; in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.” But you were unwilling,
sentence_context: For thus said the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel, “In returning and rest you shall be saved; in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.” But you were unwilling,
nuance_note: 倚靠 (trust) here is contrasted with self-reliance and seeking help from human alliances (like Egypt), emphasizing that true strength and salvation come from trusting God alone.

phrase_cn: 那报佳音，传平安，报好信，传救恩的，对锡安说：“你的神作王了！” 这人的脚登山何等佳美！
phrase_en: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace, who brings good news of happiness, who publishes salvation, who says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
sentence_context: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace, who brings good news of happiness, who publishes salvation, who says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
nuance_note: 传 (proclaim/publish) refers to the joyful and authoritative declaration of God's salvation and reign, a message of New Creation, not just the passive transmission of information.

phrase_cn: 到那日，人必说：“看哪，这是我们的神；我们素来等候他，他必拯救我们。这是耶和华，我们素来等候他；我们必因他的救恩欢喜快乐。”
phrase_en: It will be said on that day, “Behold, this is our God; we have waited for him, that he might save us. This is the LORD; we have waited for him; let us be glad and rejoice in his salvation.”
sentence_context: It will be said on that day, “Behold, this is our God; we have waited for him, that he might save us. This is the LORD; we have waited for him; let us be glad and rejoice in his salvation.”
nuance_note: 等候 (wait for) describes a persistent, hopeful anticipation of God's promised salvation and intervention, culminating in rejoicing in the new creation, not just a passive passage of time.

sentence_context: Trust in the Lord forever, for the Lord God is an everlasting rock.
trap: To 'trust' (倚靠) implies active reliance and confident dependence, not merely passive intellectual agreement.
nuance_note: The verb 'trust' (倚靠) conveys a strong sense of leaning upon or relying on God for security and stability, like resting on a solid rock.

sentence_context: Declare and present your case; let them take counsel together! Who declared this from of old? Who told it from that time? Was it not I, the Lord? And there is no other god besides me, a righteous God and a Savior; there is none besides me.
trap: To 'declare' (宣告) implies an authoritative and public announcement, often with foresight, not just a personal opinion.
nuance_note: The verb 'declare' (宣告) highlights God's sovereignty and His authoritative pronouncements, distinguishing Him from false gods who cannot foretell the future.

sentence_context: Sing for joy, O heavens, and exult, O earth; break forth into singing, O mountains! For the Lord has comforted his people and will have compassion on his afflicted.
trap: To 'comfort' (安慰) is to bring solace and deep relief in distress, not merely to 'relax' a tense situation.
nuance_note: The word 'comfort' (安慰) here signifies God's active intervention to alleviate suffering and bring hope, particularly after a period of judgment and exile.

sentence_context: In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them; in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; he lifted them up and carried them all the days of old.
trap: To 'bear' (担当) or 'carry' signifies taking on a burden or responsibility, often with effort, not merely 'holding' something lightly.
nuance_note: The verb 'carried' (担当) emphasizes God's empathetic and redemptive action, personally lifting the burden of His people's suffering through His own involvement.

sentence_context: I will wait for the Lord, who is hiding his face from the house of Jacob, and I will hope in him.
trap: To 'wait for' (等候) means active anticipation and patient endurance, often in hope, not passive idleness.
nuance_note: The verb 'wait for' (等候) conveys a sense of hopeful expectation and steadfast patience in the midst of adversity, trusting in God's eventual intervention and revelation.

sentence_context: In that day the branch of the Lord shall be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land shall be the pride and honor of the survivors of Israel.
trap: The 'remnant' (余民) or 'survivors' are God's chosen and preserved people for His redemptive plan, not mere 'leftovers' or accidental survivors.
nuance_note: The 'survivors' (余民) here represent the holy remnant whom God preserves through judgment, signifying His faithfulness to His covenant promises and future restoration.

sentence_context: Let them give glory to the Lord, and declare his praise in the coastlands.
trap: To 'declare praise' (宣告) is to publicly and emphatically announce God's greatness and acts, not just to 'say' nice things about Him.
nuance_note: The act of 'declaring praise' (宣告) is a universal call to worship and acknowledge God's saving acts, extending His fame and glory to distant nations.

sentence_context: Ah, sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, offspring of evildoers, children who deal corruptly! They have forsaken the Lord, they have despised the Holy One of Israel, they are utterly estranged.
trap: To be 'laden with' (担当) iniquity means to bear a heavy, oppressive burden of sin, not merely to 'carry' a small package of wrongdoing.
nuance_note: The phrase 'laden with iniquity' (担当) vividly portrays the cumulative and oppressive burden of sin that weighs down the nation, leading to divine judgment.

phrase_cn: 你的众子必被抱来，你的众女必被扛来。
phrase_en: Your sons shall be brought in their arms, and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.
sentence_context: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I will lift up my hand to the nations, and raise my signal to the peoples; and they shall bring your sons in their arms, and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.”
nuance_note: The Hebrew verb for 'carried' (נָשָׂא - nasa) here signifies carrying or conveying, relating to the broader concept of 'bear' (担当). It emphasizes tender, protective transportation during restoration, not a burden or suffering, illustrating God's compassionate new creation.
